text_section1.text: He stood alone in the city street facing the fear and wrath of a frightened mob! And no power on Earth could convince them of the truth... for he was...

text_section2.text: Half Man - Half What

text_section1.text: They keep thinking I'm hostile! They won't give me time to save myself... there's only one thing to do!
As a tense, grim-faced man strides quickly from a down town store...

text_section2.text: Good day, sir! Thank you for your business... and I hope your bad tooth gets better!

text_section3.text: The clerk suspects nothing amiss! Thank goodness! This new chemical will have to work... it must!

text_section1.text: Suddenly, fate reaches out for the hurrying figure in the form of a speeding car...
Then...

text_section2.text: What happened? Car crash up?

text_section1.text: Stunned citizens come forward to view an incredible impact between man and machine...

text_section2.text: I... I hit him good... real good! But he just ran away! Gosh! Look at my car!

text_section3.text: Suffering cats! The metal's dented... scrapped like it hit a pick axe!

text_section1.text: And while the crowd gaped in bewilderment --

text_section2.text: The young fool! Why did he have to hit me on the right side?

text_section1.text: At all costs I mustn't let them find me!
... they'd never believe what they see! Nothing on Earth could make them understand the frightening fate that's befallen me!
As dusk falls, the torn figure slips through the back alleys.

text_section2.text: My metallic side is creaking again... must get back to the lab and oil it!

text_section1.text: And later, the half man, half robot sits within his laboratory in deep despair...

text_section2.text: That accursed experiment... why did I ever have to begin it? If only I had never entered the lead-filled testing chamber door!

text_section1.text: Why... why did I have to meddle with nature...

text_section2.text: The rented uranium cylinder has arrived, Dr. Talbot! Frankly, I'm a bit nervous about making such a dangerous experiment in a private laboratory!

text_section3.text: Then get out Perry! I can't have frightened assistants disturbing me!

text_section1.text: If I'm right the processes of nature will be speeded up a million years! My metallic solution combined with uranium radiation should bring on instant petrification!
It works! The tree and stump have solidified! But... great grief! They haven't petrified! It appears they've become metallic!
Then, when the excitement of the moment stole my senses...

text_section2.text: Yiiii! The radiation switch... I forgot to throw it off!

text_section1.text: Ha, Ha! Yes, my experiment was a success... but I was the victim! While aging timber a million years in time, I myself became a half-metal creature!

text_section2.text: Dr. Talbot!

text_section1.text: This is the police! Let us in! We've heard you had an accident down town, Dr. Talbot!

text_section2.text: That fool clerk... he must have seen the accident from his store and identified me! They're curious, puzzled because my metallic side smashed the vehicle!

text_section1.text: Talbot's awesome arm reached out to grasp the window bars in a vise-like grip!

text_section2.text: If I'm discovered they'll think I'm dangerous... confine me! Got to elude them... find time to develop an antidote for my condition!

text_section1.text: But outside, the world is waiting for the man who was only half human...

text_section2.text: Great thunder! Look!

text_section1.text: You fools! Leave me alone!

text_section2.text: Don't let him escape! Block him off with the squad car!

text_section1.text: Why won't you listen to me? I'm in trouble! I must be left alone!
Send a squad car! There's something wrong with Dr. Talbot! He's running wild down junction boulevard!
There he is! Great grief! We'd better use the tear gas!

text_section2.text: They won't listen! They won't heed me!

text_section1.text: Go back! Go back! Don't make me harm you!

text_section2.text: Poof!

text_section1.text: Then, as the tear gas envelops Talbot his half human, half mechanical brain fights for reason...

text_section2.text: Must control myself...

text_section1.text: ... The robot part of my brain is racing! How long will I be able to control my thought?
T-there's only one chance... one chance to save them... and myself!
Suddenly the trapped scientist turns and flees...

text_section2.text: He's frightened off!

text_section3.text: Looks like he's returning to the lab... let's go!

text_section1.text: ... And moments later, inside the laboratory...

text_section2.text: I have time for only one experiment with the new chemical to seek the antidote for my condition!

text_section1.text: I can only pray that I'm right! I'll either be all man again!
I'm normal again! Th-the second dose of uranium radiation has reversed the process -- t-thank goodness!

text_section2.text: The end
